TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OlsTrainer extends Microsoft.ML.Trainers.TrainerEstimatorBase`2<class Microsoft.ML.Data.RegressionPredictionTransformer`1<class Microsoft.ML.Trainers.OlsModelParameters>, class Microsoft.ML.Trainers.OlsModelParameters>
Public NotInheritable Class OlsTrainer Inherits TrainerEstimatorBase(Of RegressionPredictionTransformer(Of OlsModelParameters), OlsModelParameters)

Docs.summary: The for training a linear regression model using ordinary least squares (OLS) for estimating the parameters of the linear regression model.

remarks.format:
To create this trainer, use [Ols](xref:Microsoft.ML.MklComponentsCatalog.Ols(Microsoft.ML.RegressionCatalog.RegressionTrainers,System.String,System.String,System.String)) or [Ols(Options)](xref:Microsoft.ML.MklComponentsCatalog.Ols(Microsoft.ML.RegressionCatalog.RegressionTrainers,Microsoft.ML.Trainers.OlsTrainer.Options)).
[!include[io](~/../docs/samples/docs/api-reference/io-columns-regression.md)]
### Trainer Characteristics | | | | -- | -- | | Machine learning task | Regression | | Is normalization required? | Yes | | Is caching required? | No | | Required NuGet in addition to Microsoft.ML | Microsoft.ML.Mkl.Components |
### Training Algorithm Details [Ordinary least squares (OLS)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordinary_least_squares) is a parameterized regression method. It assumes that the conditional mean of the dependent variable follows a linear function of the dependent variables. The regression parameters can be estimated by minimizing the squares of the difference between observed values and the predictions
Check the See Also section for links to usage examples.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Info As TrainerInfo
